alert.note: Alert for Bakersfield; Buttonwillow - Lost Hills - I5; Fresno-Clovis; Los Banos - Dos Palos; Planada - Le Grand - Snelling; South End San Joaquin Valley; Southeast San Joaquin Valley; Visalia - Porterville - Reedley; West Side of Fresno and Kings Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Watch issued January 28 at 10:53AM PST until February 02 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures as low as 26 degrees possible. * WHERE...Los Banos Dos Palos, -West Side of Fresno and Kings Counties, Buttonwillow Lost Hills -I5, Visalia -Porterville - - Reedley, Bakersfield, Southeast San Joaquin Valley and South End San Joaquin Valley. * WHEN...From late Monday night through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
